title: How will 5G pave the way for mobile app innovation? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to the 2020 survey conducted by GSMA, 5G will account for 15% of the global mobile industry by 2025, with a predicted 1.4 billion devices operating on a 5G network. And for the mobile app development industry, the introduction of 5G is going to offer new opportunities for app developers and not just influence the way people use connectivity on the devices. Coming years are going to experience new trends in gaming apps with the fastest and more personalized user experience with 5G-ready apps. From Artificial Intelligence, machine learning, AR/VR, to IoT apps, industry is fully focused to spur innovation with the 5G magic. It’s important to stay prepared for a whirlwind of 5G adoption in the mobile apps market before it becomes a crazy new trend of 5G enabled mobile app development. response.answer_text: To be honest, we’ve kind of hit a wall with app innovation. Unless we get drastically new form factors (like the Galaxy Fold), apps are going to remain stuck the way they are now. 5G doesn’t do anything on its own, sure it partnership with other features like 120Hz screens and more powerful processors, there are somethings that can be done. The biggest impact 5G will have, at least in the next 2–3 years will be: Cloud-based gaming like Amazon Luna, Google Stadia etc.Streaming services like Apple Music, Netflix and Disney+Real-time AR applications in mapsThat’s it. But like I said before, all this will be in sync with other advancements. 5G on its own cannot do much. It will just give us faster internet, which you will only notice when doing one of the above 3.
